H0.text: Diffusion is the method by which paracrine signals move through the extracellular matrix.

H1.text: Osmosis is the method by which paracrine signals move through the extracellular matrix.

H2.text: Deposition is the method by which paracrine signals move through the extracellular matrix.

H3.text: Transfusion is the method by which paracrine signals move through the extracellular matrix.

A4.text: Signaling molecules known as paracrine factors diffuse over a relatively short distance (local action).

A5.text: Signaling molecules known as paracrine factors diffuse over a relatively short distance (local action), as opposed to cell signaling by endocrine factors, hormones which travel considerably longer distances via the circulatory system.
